Clue to convey: Warp transmitters require a warp receiver (context: wait, the warp receiver isnt installed yet!)
<color=orange>Excavation Site</color>
1
ILEX: Greetings, Bells! I had a question regarding the <color=orange>Quantum Moon Locator</color> on <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow,</color> and hoped you might be able to indulge my curiosity.
2
1
ILEX: As it is difficult to calculate shuttle trajectories to a quantum destination, Solanum has asked me to travel to <color=lightblue>Ember Twin</color> today to share a set of eyes for her pilgrimage.
3
2
ILEX: However, while traveling here, I was reminded of the existence of a second <color=orange>Quantum Moon Locator</color> on <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow..</color> I am curious why we could not have used this locator for the same purpose!
4
1
BELLS: Greetings, Ilex! I am proud to hear a young Nomai seeking out such questions on their own initiative! But the reason is quite simple.
5
4
BELLS: You see, unlike the locator on <color=lightblue>Ember Twin,</color> the locator here on <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color> was built underground to protect its delicate sensors from meteor impacts.
6
5
BELLS: Unfortunately, this means that much of the sky is obscured at this site - which would make using the rule of quantum imaging much more difficult at this locator.
7
6
ILEX: I see.. What a pity! I had hoped to use the locator on <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color> to use the rule of quantum imaging without enduring the heat on this planet..
8
7
BELLS: I can only offer you my compassion, young Ilex.. Perhaps when the time comes for your pilgrimage, we will have devised a way for Nomai to use the rule of quantum imaging from afar!
